title: List My Wants and Must Haves

content.content: Whether you’re trying to find your first job or you’re making a midlife career change, one helpful step is making a “Must have” and a “Want” list.

content.subheading: Taking the time to think through these 2 lists before diving into your search can help you:
items: Avoid making the wrong job choice
Consider growth opportunities. Many internships or entry-level jobs might not involve the most exciting day-to-day tasks, but they could offer growth opportunities that benefit your future.
Look at your schedule and location. What days and hours are you available to work? Can you realistically take a job that’s located an hour away? What amount of commute time would you accept?

Include a salary range. What salary range does a job need to hit in order for you to consider it? Include that range in your must have list, and bump it up to a more comfortable range for your wants list.
Examine benefits. Many companies offer medical and dental coverage. Some others include a 401K match and continued education opportunities.
Don’t forget culture. If a company’s culture clashes with your values and personality, your happiness is likely to suffer. What is important to you when it comes to culture?
